content.question:
A food scientist conducting a study to investigate the nutritional habits of teenagers in a city selected a random sample of <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> teenagers in the city. Each of the <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> teenagers was asked to complete a survey with questions about age and the number of ounces of carbonated drinks consumed on the previous day.
Assuming the conditions for inference have been met, which of the following is an appropriate test and alternative hypothesis to use to investigate whether the average number of ounces of carbonated drinks consumed in a day increases with age for teenagers in the city?

choices.label: A <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>-test for the slope of a regression model with alternative hypothesis: <math alttext="H sub a: beta is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>β</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

A <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>-test for the slope of a regression model with alternative hypothesis: <math alttext="H sub a: beta is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>β</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

A <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>-test for the slope of a regression model with alternative hypothesis: <math alttext="H sub a: beta equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>a</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math>-test for a population proportion with alternative hypothesis: <math alttext="H sub a: p is greater 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>p</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>-test for a difference of two population means with alternative hypothesis: <math alttext="H sub a: mu sub Older is not equal to mu sub Younger" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: A <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>-test for the slope of a regression model with alternative hypothesis: <math alttext="H sub a: beta is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mo>:</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>β</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.4: Setting Up a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
